00062 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00063 #include <config.h>

00067 #include <library/i_error.h>

00069 #include "mfile.h"

00071 /* Alloc pools */
00072 L_Alloc_Pool *Mfile_pool = NULL;
00073 L_Alloc_Pool *Mline_pool = NULL;
00074 L_Alloc_Pool *Mptr_pool = NULL;
00075 
00076 /* Print out buffer and put an arrow to the character specified */
00077 void
00078 print_buf_with_arrow (FILE * out, char *buf, int pos)
00079 {
00080   int i, ch;
00081   int col, arrow_col;
00082 
00083   /* Start in column 0 */
00084   col = 0;
00085   arrow_col = 0;
00086 
00087   /* Print out text, upto newline after pos.
00088    * (Since expanded text can have many newlines in it)
00089    */
00090   for (i = 0; buf[i] != 0; i++)
00091     {
00092       ch = buf[i];
00093 
00094       /* Get column arrow should go at */
00095       if (i == pos)
00096         arrow_col = col;
00097 
00098       col++;
00099 
00100       /* Expand tabs */
00101       if (ch == '\t')
00102         {
00103           /* Put out first character */
00104           putc (' ', out);
00105 
00106           /* Add spaces until at multiple of 8 */
00107           while ((col % 8) != 0)
00108             {
00109               col++;
00110               putc (' ', out);
00111             }
00112 
00113         }
00114       else
00115         putc (ch, out);
00116 
00117       /* Handle newlines */
00118       if (ch == '\n')
00119         {
00120           /* Return to column 0 at newline */
00121           col = 0;
00122 
00123           /* Stop at newline after pos */
00124           if (i >= pos)
00125             break;
00126         }
00127     }
00128 
00129   /* Get column arrow should go at (if past end of buf) */
00130   if (i <= pos)
00131     arrow_col = col;
00132 
00133   /* Add trailing newline if none in buffer */
00134   if (buf[i] != '\n')
00135     putc ('\n', out);
00136 
00137 
00138 
00139   /* Put arrow at appropriate column detected in above loop */
00140   for (i = 0; i < arrow_col; i++)
00141     putc (' ', out);
00142   fprintf (out, "^\n");
00143 }

00146 /*
00147  * Mfile error handler.
00148  * First argument is a mptr that points to where the error occured.
00149  * The second argument is a printf format string, and the rest
00150  * are the arguments for the format string.
00151  */
00152 void
00153 Merror (Mptr * mptr, char *fmt, ...)
00154 {
00155   va_list args;
00156 
00157   /* 
00158    * Print out text line of text where error occured and put arrow to
00159    * location.  (pos starts at 0, so add 1 to get column)
00160    */
00161   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00162   /* If not at EOF */
00163   if (mptr->mline != NULL)
00164     {
00165       fprintf (stderr,
00166                "Error during %s (line %i char %i of %s):\n",
00167                mptr->mfile->desc,
00168                mptr->mline->line_no, mptr->pos + 1, mptr->mfile->name);
00169     }
00170   /* If at EOF */
00171   else
00172     {
00173       fprintf (stderr,
00174                "Error during %s (%s at EOF):\n",
00175                mptr->mfile->desc, mptr->mfile->name);
00176     }
00177 
00178   /*Print error message */
00179   va_start (args, fmt);
00180   vfprintf (stderr, fmt, args);
00181   va_end (args);
00182   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00183   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00184 
00185   /* Do not print out file text if at EOF */
00186   if (mptr->mline != NULL)
00187     {
00188       /* Print out file text where error occurred */
00189       fprintf (stderr, "File text where error occurred:\n");
00190       print_buf_with_arrow (stderr, mptr->mline->buf, mptr->pos);
00191     }
00192 
00193   fprintf (stderr, "Fatal error, cannot continue.\n");
00194   fprintf (stderr, "\n");
00195 
00196   exit (-1);
00197 }
00198 
00199 /* Loads file into memory (Mfile structure) and returns a newly 
00200  * allocated Mfile structure.
00201  */
00202 Mfile *
00203 create_Mfile (FILE * in, char *input_file_name, char *desc)
00204 {
00205   Mfile *mfile;
00206   Mline *mline;
00207   Mbuf *mbuf;
00208   int ch;
00209   int len;
00210 
00211   /* Allocate structure for Mfile, create pools if necessary */
00212   if (Mfile_pool == NULL)
00213     {
00214       Mfile_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Mfile", sizeof (Mfile), 16);
00215     }
00216   if (Mline_pool == NULL)
00217     {
00218       Mline_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Mline", sizeof (Mline), 256);
00219     }
00220 
00221   mfile = (Mfile *) L_alloc (Mfile_pool);
00222 
00223   /* Initialize fields */
00224   mfile->name = strdup (input_file_name);
00225   mfile->desc = strdup (desc);
00226   mfile->head = 0;
00227   mfile->tail = 0;
00228   mfile->line_count = 0;
00229 
00230   /* Create mbuf for file */
00231   mbuf = create_Mbuf ();
00232 
00233   /* Read in file */
00234   while (1)
00235     {
00236       /* Clear mbuf so we can put the next line it it */
00237       clear_Mbuf (mbuf);
00238 
00239       while ((ch = getc (in)) != EOF)
00240         {
00241           /* Add character to mbuf */
00242           addc_to_Mbuf (mbuf, ch);
00243 
00244           /* If hit newline, end line */
00245           if (ch == '\n')
00246             break;
00247         }
00248 
00249       /* Add line if Mbuf not empty */
00250       if ((len = len_of_Mbuf (mbuf)) > 0)
00251         {
00252           /* Increment line count */
00253           mfile->line_count++;
00254 
00255           /* Allocate a Mline for this line */
00256           mline = (Mline *) L_alloc (Mline_pool);
00257 
00258           /* Init contents of line */
00259           mline->buf = copy_Mbuf_buf (mbuf);
00260           mline->len = len;
00261           mline->line_no = mfile->line_count;
00262           mline->mfile = mfile;
00263 
00264           /* Add to mfile's linked list of lines */
00265           if (mfile->tail == NULL)
00266             mfile->head = mline;
00267           else
00268             mfile->tail->next = mline;
00269           mline->prev = mfile->tail;
00270           mline->next = NULL;
00271           mfile->tail = mline;
00272         }
00273 
00274       /* Stop at EOF */
00275       if (ch == EOF)
00276         break;
00277     }
00278 
00279   /* Free up allocated memory */
00280   free_Mbuf (mbuf);
00281 
00282   return (mfile);
00283 }
00284 
00285 /* Free memory Mfile is using */
00286 void
00287 free_Mfile (Mfile * mfile)
00288 {
00289   Mline *mline, *next_mline;
00290 
00291   /* Free all the lines in the mfile */
00292   for (mline = mfile->head; mline != NULL; mline = next_mline)
00293     {
00294       /* Get next mline before we delete anything */
00295       next_mline = mline->next;
00296 
00297       /* Free buffer and L_free structure */
00298       free (mline->buf);
00299       L_free (Mline_pool, mline);
00300     }
00301 
00302   /* Free name buffer and L_free structure */
00303   free (mfile->name);
00304   free (mfile->desc);
00305   L_free (Mfile_pool, mfile);
00306 }
00307 
00308 /* Create mptr to start of mfile */
00309 Mptr *
00310 create_Mptr (Mfile * mfile)
00311 {
00312   Mptr *mptr;
00313 
00314   if (Mptr_pool == NULL)
00315     {
00316       Mptr_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("Mptr", sizeof (Mptr), 16);
00317     }
00318   mptr = (Mptr *) L_alloc (Mptr_pool);
00319 
00320   mptr->mfile = mfile;
00321   mptr->mline = mfile->head;
00322   mptr->pos = 0;
00323 
00324   return (mptr);
00325 }
00326 /* Duplicates a Mptr exactly 
00327  * Returns the duplicated Mptr (must be freed)
00328  */
00329 Mptr *
00330 copy_Mptr (Mptr * orig_mptr)
00331 {
00332   Mptr *new_mptr;
00333 
00334   /* alloc and copy over fields */
00335   new_mptr = (Mptr *) L_alloc (Mptr_pool);
00336 
00337   new_mptr->mfile = orig_mptr->mfile;
00338   new_mptr->mline = orig_mptr->mline;
00339   new_mptr->pos = orig_mptr->pos;
00340 
00341   return (new_mptr);
00342 }
00343 
00344 /* Moves the old mptr to the new mptr location */
00345 void
00346 move_Mptr (Mptr * old_mptr, Mptr * new_mptr)
00347 {
00348   old_mptr->mfile = new_mptr->mfile;
00349   old_mptr->mline = new_mptr->mline;
00350   old_mptr->pos = new_mptr->pos;
00351 }
00352 
00353 
00354 void
00355 free_Mptr (Mptr * mptr)
00356 {
00357   /* L_free structure */
00358   L_free (Mptr_pool, mptr);
00359 }
00360 
00361 /* Gets the next character from the mfile. */
00362 int
00363 Mgetc (Mptr * mptr)
00364 {
00365   int ch;
00366 
00367   /* If at EOF, return EOF */
00368   if (mptr->mline == NULL)
00369     return (EOF);
00370 
00371   /* Get next character in file */
00372   ch = mptr->mline->buf[mptr->pos];
00373 
00374   /* Goto next character, and next line if necessary */
00375   mptr->pos++;
00376   if (mptr->pos >= mptr->mline->len)
00377     {
00378       mptr->mline = mptr->mline->next;
00379       mptr->pos = 0;
00380     }
00381 
00382   return (ch);
00383 }
00384 
00385 /* Returns char position on line of Mptr */
00386 int
00387 Mptr_pos (Mptr * mptr)
00388 {
00389   return (mptr->pos);
00390 }
00391 
00392 /* Peeks at the next character from the mfile. */
00393 int
00394 Mpeekc (Mptr * mptr)
00395 {
00396   char ch;
00397 
00398   if (mptr->mline == NULL)
00399     ch = EOF;
00400   else
00401     ch = mptr->mline->buf[mptr->pos];
00402 
00403   return (ch);
00404 }
00405 
00406 /* Backup one character in the file.
00407  * Cannot backup before beginning of file.
00408  */
00409 void
00410 Mbackupc (Mptr * mptr)
00411 {
00412   /* If at EOF, goto last character in file */
00413   if (mptr->mline == NULL)
00414     {
00415       mptr->mline = mptr->mfile->tail;
00416       if (mptr->mline != NULL)
00417         mptr->pos = mptr->mline->len - 1;
00418     }
00419 
00420   /* If at beginning of file, goto end of last line */
00421   else if (mptr->pos == 0)
00422     {
00423       mptr->mline = mptr->mline->prev;
00424       if (mptr->mline != NULL)
00425         mptr->pos = mptr->mline->len - 1;
00426       else
00427         I_punt ("Mbackupc: backing up before beginning of file.");
00428     }
00429 
00430   /* Otherwise, just go backwards one character */
00431   else
00432     {
00433       mptr->pos--;
00434     }
00435 }
